lexUnit.name: fault.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: criticize for inadequacy or mistakes.

sentence.text: But it was not so long ago that many leading Tories faulted it for being mismanaged , diffused , uncertain , failing to set the agenda ; in a word , bad .
` I could not fault my players for commitment .
We did n't give up tonight and kept plugging away and I ca n't fault the players for effort . "
YOU can not fault Gerald Ronson for the professionalism of his approach to his liquidity crisis .
` I could not fault the way in which the port authority conducted their responsibilities .

The defending solicitor tried to fault her on identification but she described the car as having a metallic paint job , wide wheels and a number of triangular stickers in the rear window ; she also thought that she could remember a couple of fluffy dice hanging from the rear-view mirror , and she gave the first three letters of the registration number .
It is the text , however , where I fear I must fault the guide at times .
But her colleagues and superiors could not fault her dedication to the job , speaking highly of her nursing ability .
Alinova 's claims are hard to fault .
His facts ( although not always his glosses ) can not usually be faulted , and he was ideally placed to give the definitive account of events after Edward 's death .
The arithmetic can not be faulted -- and may well be judged too clever by half .
As far as that sort of thing goes they ca n't be faulted .
Though the findings of modern geology relating to the origins of islands in the archipelago were not available to Wallace , his observations on the wildlife of Sulawesi can hardly be faulted .

Cohen-Solal 's identification of three strategies , expertise , orthodoxy and prestige , enabling these three prominent communists to carve out a particular niche for themselves within the party structure , can not be faulted .
If one wanted to meet someone in London who is in fact elsewhere and had to spend a morning travelling which one could pleasantly have spent in bed , then the desire to travel can be faulted .
We are of the view that the judge 's approach to the aspect of the case concerned with the Code can not be faulted .
Service rating : No firm commitment , but the Taff teacher 's husband ca n't be faulted for attitude .
Neither judge could be faulted for acting as he did , Lord Lane added .
Hooper , chosen ahead of David James because of his experience , could not be faulted for either of the Russians ' goals and desperately wants a chance to make the Anfield number one shirt his own .
Although as a general he may be faulted , in diplomatic skill and political understanding he towered head and shoulders above his Middle Eastern rivals , Muslim and Christian alike .
It could not be faulted in respect of how clean and tidy she kept it .

In the judgment delivered on 7th May the court found that Section 79 had been correctly interpreted by the Law Society and that the Assistant Director 's decision could not be faulted in terms of rationality or fairness .
The judge can not be faulted either on the course he took or on the decision he reached on the material before him .
` Certainly , I can not fault the Caroline Hastings Public Relations machine , " Roman agreed silkily .
You could n't fault her out there .
Did she fault the landlords or tenants for shoddiness and dirt ?
No one can fault the absolute loyalty that Willie gave to Ted and then Margaret .
` I could n't fault the midfield today .
The crowd were fabulous and you could not fault any of the players .
I could n't really fault the Stylus 800 .
Few could fault them if this time round their ` big exam day " nerves were compounded by the raging controversy surrounding the new transfer test .
She was selfless and I can not fault the way she dealt with me -- not the easiest of her five children .
He could not fault the appearance of the almost-finished uniform , and he understood nothing of the tailor 's craft .
He chose a five percent discount rate table and in my opinion nobody could fault such a choice .
I could n't fault the descriptions , although I did find it a little irritating to be several paragraphs into each section before the actual route of ascent was revealed .
You can not fault the performances of the two main characters .
When I 'm reading it I feel you ca n't fault the philosophy .
The North Region PGA brought an event to the Darlington municipal course for the first time and tournament controller Les Massey said : ` We ca n't fault this place .
I said that I could n't fault their prices , but asked what would happen if I did n't pay .
We do n't like each other , but you ca n't fault my sense of hospitality .
It 's not something on which one could fault the Victorians , for instance . "
